item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Discussion and possible action on coastal-related legislation. (JA/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Informational Presentation on MRCA/SMMC 2022 Coastal Access Program Accomplishments and 2023 Work Plan
subitem_blurb: Presentation by Mountains Recreation and Conservation Authority staff on MRCA/SMMC 2022 Coastal Access Program Accomplishments and 2023 Work Plan for the Malibu Coast and Santa Monica Mountains in Los Angeles County

subitem_title: Reconsideration of 2023 Meeting Schedule
subitem_blurb: Discussion and possible action on revision of current meeting schedule for 2023. (VM/KH-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0234 (Del Villar, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Angel Del Villar to remove 931 sq.ft. unpermitted dock float and construct new 920 sq. ft. floating dock, with three (3) 16-in. guide piles and 3’ x 18’ gangway, at 16842 Marina Bay Drive, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0501 (Kang, Sunset Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Kevin Kang for after-the-fact approval for construction of 144 sq.ft. floating dock with 3’ x 18’ gangway and two (2) 14-in. guide piles at 16791 Bayview Drive, Sunset Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0895 (Archer, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Scott Archer to modify 404 sq.ft. “T” shaped floating dock resulting in 241 sq.ft. “L” shaped floating dock; 3’ x 20’ gangway will be replaced with 3’ x 24’ gangway; no changes are proposed to 277 sq.ft. pier; two existing 14-in concrete guide piles will be reused in new locations at 918 East Balboa Boulevard, Newport Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0887 (Goodman Development, Inc., Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Goodman Development, Inc. to construct two-story, 2,743 sq.ft. single family home with roof deck and attached 440 sq.ft. two car garage on vacant lot.  Grading will consist of 75 cu. yds. of import, 75 cu. yds. of fill and 180 cu. yds. of overexcavation, located at 106 Central Avenue, Seal Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0888 (Goodman Development, Inc., Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Goodman Development, Inc. to construct two-story, 2,712 sq.ft. single family home with roof deck and attached 497 sq.ft. two car garage on vacant lot.  Grading will consist of 75 cu. yds. of import, 75 cu. yds. of fill and 180 cu. yds. of overexcavation, located at 108 Central Avenue, Seal Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0562 (Bowman, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Robert Bowman to remove 30-ft. long, cast-in place bulkhead and replace it along the same alignment with new Truline pile wall; and install two new tie-backs connecting to one new concrete deadman at 506 38th Street, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0843 (Randolph, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Joe and Andrea Randolph to demolish a one-story, 880 sq. ft. single-family home, and construct new 2-story, 2,884 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 570 sq.ft. garage and 893 sq.ft. rooftop deck at 132 12th Street, Seal Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0962 (Olson, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Ethan Olson to construct 2-story, 25 ft.-high, 2,850 sq.ft., single-family home, detached 3-car garage, and new perimeter fences along rear and side property lines on vacant lot at 216 16th St, Seal Beach, Orange County. (VL-LB)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0460 (City of Newport Beach, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Newport Beach to implement Western Snowy Plover Management Plan in East Balboa Peninsula beaches, including to install approx. 3,000 ft. of seasonal post and cable fencing, associated interpretive and educational signage;  remove E Street Concrete walkway, volleyball courts, and associated recreational structures from critical habitat area, and coastal dune habitat restoration and monitoring in Newport Beach, Orange County. (MR-LB)(Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. A-5-LGB-22-0025 (Gray, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Mike & Lori Gray to construct two-story, 30’ high, 3,552 sq.ft. single-family home and attached 489 sq.ft. garage at 1007 Gaviota Dr., Laguna Beach, Orange County. (BW-LB) Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0627 (Orange County Public Works, Irvine)
subitem_blurb: Application of Orange County Public Works for San Diego Creek Pilot Program, which includes removal of sediment and vegetation within 0.23-acr. plot to measure rates of natural, native revegetation; 400 cu. yds. of cut and no fill proposed, located in Irvine, Orange County. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-22-0060 (City of Laguna Beach, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark and Sharon Fudge from City of Laguna Beach decision granting permit to City of Laguna Beach for demolition of sewer lift station, installation of new sewer lift station, stairway reconstruction, Anita Street end improvements, landscaping, and installation of permanent lifeguard tower at Westerly Terminus of Anita Street, Public-Right-of-Way, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (BW-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-22-0061 (Corwin, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark Fudge from City of Laguna Beach decision granting permit with conditions to Jack Corwin for construction of new perimeter fencing on residential coastal bluff lot at 31351-31355 Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County (MV-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-DPT-23-0004 (Seidensticker, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Chair Donne Brownsey and Vice Chair Caryl Hart from City of Dana Point decision granting permit with conditions to John and Marcella Seidensticker for demolition of 892 sq.ft., one-story single-family home with attached one-car garage, and construction of 2,710 sq.ft., 2-story single-family home with attached 1,258 sq.ft., three-car garage, supported by caisson foundation, on 2,476 sq.ft. oceanfront lot at 35697 Beach Road, Capistrano Beach, Dana Point, Orange County. (SA-LB)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Oceanside LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-OCN-21-0077-2 (Coast Highway Incentive District)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Oceanside to amend its certified Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to facilitate redevelopment along Coast Highway. (TR-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0044-2 (Build Better SD)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director's determination that the request by City of San Diego to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to revise developer impact fees to be allocated city wide, is de minimis. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0065-3 (Pushcart Repeal)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Implementation Plan to remove most regulations regarding pushcarts in the public right-of-way. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 6-21-0738 (Del Mar Sand Compatibility and Opportunistic Use Program (SCOUP), Del Mar)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Del Mar to implement a sand replenishment program to allow for multiple beach replenishment projects over a 5-year period for maximum total of 180,000 cu. yds., and periodic excavation from the San Dieguito River inlet to nourish proposed receiver sites in Del Mar, San Diego County. (SL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 6-23-0106 (San Diego La Jolla Navigation Buoys, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of San Diego to place 9 seasonal navigational buoys and 1 permanent buoy in the waters off La Jolla Cove to demarcate public swimming areas at 2000 Spindrift Drive and 1160 Coast Boulevard, La Jolla, San Diego. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0715 (Noonan, Santa Monica)
subitem_blurb: Application by Tim & Christina Noonan to demolish one-story, 1,406 sq.ft., single-family home and accessory unit and construct 39ft. tall, three-story, 4,447 sq.ft. single-family home with 638 sq.ft. attached ADU and 707 sq.ft. attached garage on two tied lots totaling 4,998 sq.ft. at 1419 Palisades Beach Road, Santa Monica, Los Angeles County. (KT-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0927 (Antin, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Application of Robert and Patricia Antin to construct new 2,157 sq.ft., 2-story, single-family home with attached three-car garage and roof deck on vacant 3,143 sq.ft. lot at 117 Westwind Mall, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (SA-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

item_title: Consent Cease and Desist Order No. CCC-23-CD-01 (1205-1207 Wooster Street LLC and Henri Levy, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles Co.)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed administrative action authorizing and ordering  1205-1207 Wooster Street LLC, as record owner of property located at 16701 Via La Costa, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles County (“Property”), to: 1) return the Property to its pre-violation condition by opening the public parking lot and making it available for public use, and by cleaning the restrooms and surrounding areas of the Property; 2) comply with the existing CDP for development on the Property, as amended, by complying with the requirement to transfer the Property to the City of Los Angeles or a not-for profit entity approved by the Commission’s Executive Director at no cost to the receiving entity; and 3) dismiss the Commission from pending litigation regarding the Trailhead Property, and dismiss the quiet title claim in that litigation. (HJ-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-FTB-23-0002 (Caltrans, Fort Bragg).
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jacob Patterson and Annemarie Weibel of decision of City of Fort Bragg granting permit with conditions to Caltrans to construct the Fort Bragg ADA Improvement Project along Highway 1 (Main Street) between Highway 20 (post mile 59.80) and Elm Street (PM 62.10) involving various transportation facility improvements (including, but not limited to, sidewalks, crosswalks, drainage improvements, and retaining walls) to improve the transportation corridor consistent with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) standards, Fort Bragg, Mendocino County. (MA-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0251 (Sorrel Leaf Healing Center, Inc, Eureka)
subitem_blurb: Application of Sorrel Leaf Healing Center, Inc. to develop mental health crisis facility for children in existing 4,872-sq.ft., 3-story single-family home, including (1) renovate home and accessory building and replace attached carport with 2,428-sq.ft addition to accommodate total of 12 patient beds, six bathrooms, several therapy rooms, various administration and operation spaces,  kitchen and dining facilities, and total anticipated staff of 24 during peak operation hours; (2) construct 462-ssq.ft. yoga pavilion, 600-sq.ft. greenhouse, and 1,176-sq.ft. barn for small livestock therapy animals; (3) install new onsite septic system; (4) reconfigure and expand parking area to include 27 off-street parking spaces, two ADA van-accessible spaces, and two hammerhead turnarounds for emergency vehicles; and (5) install signage, fencing, vegetation screening, and stormwater drainage swales on 13.5-acre lot at 124 Indianola Road, Eureka. (TRG-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-23-0007-1 (Childcare Facilities) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action up to one year on the County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend the Implementation Plan portion of its certified LCP to amend sections of the LIP regarding childcare facilities and other minor corrections and revisions. (DG-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. A-4-STB-19-0214 (Cosmoledo Trust, Santa Barbara County)
subitem_blurb: Application of Cosmoledo Trust to construct an 847 sq.ft. addition and remodel to 2,850 sq.ft. single-family home, wood deck, pool, and spa at 711 Sand Point Road, in the Carpinteria area of unincorporated Santa Barbara County. (DG-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 4-22-0459 (Caltrans)
subitem_blurb: Application of Caltrans to replace the Northbound and Southbound U.S. 101 bridges at Refugio Creek with new clear span bridges with five traffic lanes, standard bridge railings and shoulders, fish passage improvements, pedestrian path upgrades, and restoration of public parking on Refugio Rd., near Refugio State Beach in unincorporated Santa Barbara County. (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.) (JS-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 9-22-0733 (City of Ventura, Ventura Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by City of Ventura to construct approx. 6,800-ft.-long ocean outfall and associated onshore conveyance pipeline as well as the discharge of tertiary-treated effluent from Ventura Water Reclamation Facility through outfall, City of Ventura, Ventura County. (WH-SF)

subitem_title: Consistency Determination No. CD-0010-22 (United States Air Force)
subitem_blurb: Consistency determination by the United States Air Force for Phantom Space Company’s development of a space launch complex and its use for up to 48 space launches and 48 rocket engine test events per year at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Santa Barbara County. (HW-SF)

subitem_title: Application Number 2-22-0004 (Surf Schools, Pacifica)
subitem_blurb: Application by City of Pacifica to fully authorize a Surf Camp/Surf School Program, including application and licensing scheme, at Pacifica State (Linda Mar) Beach, in Pacifica, San Mateo County.  (EM-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-23-0003-1-Part A (Tiny Homes).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by Santa Cruz County to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to provide for the use of small, trailered residential units (“Tiny Homes on Wheels”) as dwelling units is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (NC-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-23-0005-1-Part A (Flexible Density Units).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to clarify Single Room Occupancy (SRO) regulations and to rename Small Ownership Units (SOUs) as Flexible Density Units (FDUs) and amend their standards is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC)
